🦸 The Company of Heroes

Published

December 11, 2021

Modified

August 5, 2025

Who is a Stranger?

Introduction: The Company of Strangers!

How many strangers do you “meet” everyday? Why is the Human Species different from all others? Those two questions are not unrelated !!

The Human Species is perhaps unique in that we are able to cooperate with strangers!! Yes! Do you think that designing things, building and conducting a business, or making art is something like that? No? Well, let us see a few quick stories!!

Story-1

Do you know who these four people are ?

The Hero’s Journey


This is the story of a young man who leaves home from Tarbes, in Gascony, France, to travel to Paris to make his fortune. He has two blessings,one each from his mother and his father. True to the instructions given by his Dad, and his very Gascon nature, he picks a fight even before he reaches Paris.

Classic Movie Time!

Let us watch a (very very) small part of this movie, The Three Pangas Musketeers-1973. Here is the IMDB page for film buffs.

https://www.tcm.com/video/454255/three-musketeers-the-1973-movie-clip-we-are-only-three/

and this order version:

Classic Fiction Time!

Let us read aloud(!) a bit of good old classic fiction !! This is the Conversation that occurs right before the duel scene we saw in the video above.

Chapter 5. THE KING’S MUSKETEERS AND THE CARDINAL’S GUARDS.1 Keep an eye on the conversation! And an ear open for French-ified English, I beseech you!!

Here is the audio reading of this chapter from Librivox.org

Discussion-1

  • “When have to shoot, shoot! Don’t talk!” said Eli Wallach.
  • Pardon,m’sieu, but why were they so polite to each other? (Oh, These French…)
  • Were they talking as if they didn’t want to fight?
  • But to “have fought already”?
  • The Shadow of the Future

Story-2

What about this game ?

Discussion-2

What emotions or motivations are portrayed by the characters in the story? We can think of the “4Rs”:

  • Reward
  • Regret aka FOMO
  • Risk
  • Retribution/Punishment

Nice Guys Finish First

Wait, But Why?

  • Many public behaviours require us to trust strangers
  • We have Rule of Law based on this trust
  • If there is no C at first, then everybody does a D
  • That is the source of the Dilemma
  • As Artists and Designers, and Creators, we need to practice our craft that in such a way as to induce niceness…
  • So what will you make? A movie? An ad? A public sign-board? A street play? An illustration? A “spatial arrangement”? A policy or a law?

References

  1. John D. Williams, The Compleat Strategyst: Being a Primer on the Theory of Games of Strategy, RAND Corporation, ISBN:9780833042224. This is a very humourous and fun book on Game Theory ! It is available for free online at the RAND Corporation Website.
  2. Ken Binmore,Playing for Real: A Text on Game Theory, ISBN:9780195300574, Oxford University Press, March 2007. Available here.
  3. Avinash Dixit, Susan Skeath, David Reiley, Games of strategy, ISBN: 9780393124446, New York :W.W. Norton & Company, 2015.
  4. Brams Steven J., 1994. “Game Theory and Literature,” Games and Economic Behavior, Elsevier, vol. 6(1), pages 32-54, January. Available here.
  5. Alexander Mehlmann,The game’s afoot! Game theory in myth and paradox, American Mathematical Society 2000. AMS Bookstore
  6. Steven .J Brams. (February 4, 1992). Game Theory in Literature Department of Politics, New York University, New York, New York 10003. Read the PDF

Activity-1

Take your favourite show/episode, film, or short story and look at the conduct of the characters. Decide whether these were C or D, and why!

Make a Poster and put it up. Show and Tell in 1 hour!
